alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Central La Paz; Kofa; Parker Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:48PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of La Paz, northeastern Yuma, Maricopa and San Bernardino Counties through 645 PM MST... At 547 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles west of Alamo Lake to 20 miles northwest of Sundad. Movement was northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parker, Alamo Lake, Salome, Alamo State Park, Aguila, Brenda, Buckskin Mountain Park, Bouse, Gladden, Vicksburg Junction, Wenden, Kofa Wildlife Refuge, Vicksburg and Harcuvar. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 23 and 79. US Highway 60 between mile markers 31 and 94. AZ Route 72 between mile markers 14 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Central La Paz; Kofa; Parker Valley; Tonopah Desert
